isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: ROCKWELL - ASSEMBLY - KNUCKLE BEARING PRELOAD (Full Bearing Models Only)

svcproc.title: KNUCKLE BEARING PRELOAD (Full Bearing Models Only)

note.para: To get an accurate measurement of bearing preload, DO NOT assemble the steering arm linkage or tie rod assembly to the knuckle until the preload adjustment is made.

step1.para: Fasten a soft wire or cord to the tie rod arm. Attach a pound scale to the opposite end of the wire or cord. Hold the outer shaft of the universal joint away from the knuckle opening and pull on the pound scale to rotate the knuckle. Read the pounds pulled on the scale ( Figure 33). Read the pull necessary to rotate the knuckle, not the pull necessary to start the movement. The pounds pull on the scale must be between 10 and 29 lbs.
To correct the bearing preload, disassemble the upper bearing cap and remove shims to increase the preload, or add shims to decrease the preload.
Install the knuckle cap to the correct torque and check the bearing preload again.
